name: Cover Page Hero
description: Full-bleed opening page with large title, subtitle, date, and optional visual accent. Sets the tone for the entire document and must never contain body text or data visualizations.
components: Heading: $heading-07 or $display-01 for main title (max 8 words)
Subtitle: $heading-03 in $text-02 color, placed below title with $spacing-05 gap
Date line: $label-01 in $text-05, bottom-aligned or below subtitle
Optional: brand accent bar (4px $blue-60) at top or left edge
rules: Title MUST use $heading-07 (productive) or $display-01 (expressive) — never smaller than $heading-05
Subtitle uses $heading-03 with $text-02 color token for secondary hierarchy
Vertical spacing between title and subtitle is exactly $spacing-05 (16px)
Date/author line uses $label-01 at $text-05 for de-emphasized metadata
No body text, charts, tables, or data visualizations on the cover page
Background must be a single solid theme color (white or $ui-background) — no gradients or images unless explicitly provided
Force page break after cover so content starts on a fresh page
Brand accent bar: 4px height, $blue-60 fill, spans full page width at top edge

printBehavior.bleedHandling: extend background color to trim edge on all sides

accessibilityNotes: Title must be the first <h1> in the document — screen readers use heading hierarchy for navigation
Date and author metadata should use <time> and <address> semantic elements
Decorative accent bars must have aria-hidden='true' — they carry no content meaning
Ensure sufficient color contrast (4.5:1 minimum) between title text and background
antiPatterns: Never place CarbonChart, DataTable, or any data visualization on the cover page
Never use body-level typography ($body-long-01, $body-short-01) for the main title
Never include more than 6 text elements — cover must be sparse and impactful
Never use colSpan less than 16 — cover must be full-width without offsets
Never add RichText prose paragraphs to the cover — save content for page 2+
